Good evening. First of all, I thank you all for the feelings, thoughts and suggestions you share with me.
I have many congratulations on the acceptance of my son Mehmet at Harvard University. Thank you so much for the messages.
Most of our people have difficulties in their life that they do not know and most of them live in our children.
Last year Mehmet told me, "I read university in Turkey newspapers and TVs can carry me on every occasion ...
... In this case, both me and you can be sad, "he asked permission from his mother and sister to read abroad.
We gave him permission to win a good school. Because every school abroad is not good.
Hayrunnisa Hanım has a lot of training in children's education. Because of my concentration, I was not very interested in children's education.
Mehmet has always been a successful, hardworking student. He studied high school education as a scholarship student. He was accepted by the whole university in "Ivy League".
No school knew that I was my son when I entered the exams.
I also want to write a few sentences about the environment. I get very serious about environmental issues.
In this regard, I would like to take part in all the important meetings of the country and abroad to be more sensitive about the environment.
I draw attention to the issue of the environment in the opening speeches of the Parliament every year.
But now I am amazed that the great environmental disaster in the Gulf of Mexico is not as much of a place in the Turkish media.
And environmental organizations in Turkey do not reveal the necessary sensitivity to the tanker traffic in the straits.
I also read your messages on animal rights. Whether it's an animal, a plant, everything that's alive, everybody needs to be meticulous.
The higher the level of education, the greater the sensitivity in this regard. I appreciate and support NGOs operating in this area.
I try to keep track of World Cup matches when I'm home. I am sorry that Turkey is not in South Africa.
Among the teams I watched I found Brazil, Argentina and Spain impressive.
I have read the article you mentioned about Y. Türker. Unfortunately, there have been such painful events in the past.
For this, Turkey is resolutely adopting the policy of "zero tolerance against torture".
Indeed, international independent human rights organizations also report on positive developments in torture in Turkey.
It is also the duty of the state to protect children and innocent people. New legislation in this regard is on the agenda of the Assembly.
I have already shared with you this law support.
The issue of amnesty is also much discussed. Everyone thinks I have the authority to forgive the person I want. But that's not the case.
I can use amnesty for forensic medicine reports on the names coming up with the proposal of the Ministry of Justice.
Constitutionally no amnesty.
Finally, I want to write something about our women and our daughters.
I attach great importance to the education of our daughters and to the participation of our women in life.
There can be no such thing as society consuming half, producing half. The important thing is to remove the obstacles and give equal opportunity.
Good night to everyone.

Work on a new law on the police force could go faster. Intend to submit it to the State Duma personally. This law is very important.
Any provisions that enable the Interior Ministry to arbitrarily restrict the rights of individuals and companies should be excluded.
The new law on the police force should be published, e.g. on the Interior Ministry's website. We need it to be discussed extensively.
Public feedback should become a critical factor in assessing how well the police are doing their job. This should be set forth in the law.
Police reports to the media and NGOs should be substantive rather than formal.

Dozens of people were killed in terrorist bombings in Uganda. Deepest condolences to President Yoweri Museveni and families of the deceased.
Had a big meeting with our ambassadors at the Foreign Ministry. A few thoughts on its results.
Foreign policy's main goal is to improve living standards, security and cultural progress and to foster the country's overall development.
The world is currently divided in line with economic development rather than ideology. We must be on the same field as the key players.
Despite everything our relations with the US are very good, but we shouldn't miss a chance to make them even stronger.
The main thing is that Russia and the US realise that sustained development rather than weapons or spy games underlies national security.
We need modernisation alliances, first of all with Germany, France, Italy, the EU and the United States.
Russia is certain to make a contribution to tackling global challenges on a par with the other leading economies.
The Cold War is becoming a thing of the past, but we still need to get rid of a few lingering prejudices.
Iran may soon acquire nuclear capability. The Non-Proliferation Treaty doesn't prohibit having such capability. That's one of the problems.
Being honest and open with the IAEA is, first of all, good for Iran itself.

Arrived in Alekseyevka. My grandmother was born here. We will hold a State Council Presidium meeting on agriculture.
Visited my great-grandparents' graves. In childhood I heard a lot from grandma about this area. My first visit here. A work trip, as always.
Toured a sunflower oil factory. This is a state-of-the-art facility producing competitive goods. We need more factories like this.
They also make sweets here. Tried some - I have a sweet tooth though it is not healthy.

My God, my God ... My Christ, Our Christ, while I prayed silently seeing those bones, I thought of you! And as I would have liked
How much I wanted you to come and order like Lazaro: "Get up, Simon, it is not time to die." I immediately remembered that Bolivar lives!
Bolivar lives Carajo !! We are your flare!

Speaking on Labor’s approach to climate change at UQ. Stream here http://tinyurl.com/289yepn. My Team will keep you updated with snippets JG
Today I will set out my approach to the challenges of responding to climate change and reducing pollution.
My Government will create an independent, properly credentialed source of information and expert advice – a Climate Change Commission
Today I announce that, if we are re-elected, I will develop a dedicated process – a Citizens’ Assembly #ausvotes
If the Labor Government is re-elected, we will introduce a policy that rewards businesses who take early action to reduce their pollution.
So today I announce that, if we are re-elected, Labor will ensure that all new power stations will have to meet best practice standards
The Australian Government will contribute up to $1bill over 10 years to the investment needed to connect our electricity grid to new sources
If we give support to Australians to make the changes that are necessary, then I am confident that we can move forward together. #ausvotes

Held talks with Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi; as with Tarja Halonen and Angela Merkel before her, we discussed visas.
Like many other European countries, Italy fully supports the idea of visa-free travel between Russia and the EU.
Silvio Berlusconi promised to get personally involved in work on this issue. We hope the process won't take too long.

Is outlining Labor’s plan for a better health system. Stream it here http://tinyurl.com/29f6f6t My Team will update you with snippets. JG
I lead a government that is determined to tackle the long-term challenge of providing better health services for the future.
Today I would like to set out Labor’s plan to redouble our efforts for tackling suicide.
We will boost frontline services in communities for people at greatest risk of suicide in our community
We will give priority to men - who we know are often at greater risk and less likely to seek help
We will promote resilience and good mental health for both our young children and our young people

In Melbourne today giving a major speech on our National Disability Strategy. My Team will keep you updated with snippets. JG
You can stream the speech here http://tinyurl.com/29f6f6t
There is much more to be done in our journey of inclusion and reform. Today I announce another step forward: a National Disability Strategy.
The National Disability Strategy will help us create better services, programs and community infrastructure
A re-elected Gillard Labor Government will take the draft National Disability Strategy to COAG early in the next term.
Today I announce the Better Start for Children with Disabilities program.
We will provide up to $12000 for early intervention services for each child.
We will also make available a range of new diagnosis and treatment services for older children with those conditions – funded by Medicare.
Today I also announce an additional investment providing up to 150 additional places in Supported Accommodation.

National projects have proved to be an effective way to address many problems. Today we discussed the general outline for key programmes.
Two important issues today are healthcare, where we've made some progress, and energy efficiency, where we're still lagging behind.
Conserving resources and using them wisely are global trends we should follow.
It's not enough to be computer savvy and know foreign languages. A truly modern person needs to know how to be energy efficient, too.
An energy efficient lifestyle is becoming popular in developed countries. It's a good idea - one we should take note of.

The main objective is to put out fires and help the victims. Instructions have been issued, we will strengthen control in fire hazard zones.
Our goal is to prevent such disasters. The Emergencies Ministry and local services are working on it. We will do our best.

Spoke with the governors of regions affected by fires. Sergei Shoigu reviewed the situation, ministries reported on measures taken.
The prime minister is in the Nizhny Novgorod Region. We spoke on the phone about the situation, what is being done and what will be done.
Regional Development Ministry will draft individual programmes for constructing temporary and permanent housing in each region hit by fires.
This housing should be commissioned by winter, the final deadline is the end of the year.
All governors should do everything they can to contain the forest fires.
The Healthcare Ministry was directed to ensure sanitary standards at evacuee accommodations.
The Prosecutor General's Office and presidential envoys in the Volga and Central Federal Districts will oversee fire relief expenses.
The defence minister was directed to use his ministry to assist in the fire fighting effort.
*surrounded
